HelpXML.Title: HAc
HelpXML.Purpose: HAc computes breakdown point and efficiency associated with constant c

Item.Name: ctun
Item.LongDesc: Scalar greater than 0 which controls the robustness/efficiency of the estimator

Item.Name: v
Item.LongDesc: Number of variables of the dataset (for regression v=1) UP TO NOW v=1 (JUST REGRESSION) TO DO FOR MULTIVARIATE ANALYSIS

Item.Name: param
Item.LongDesc: Vector of length 3 specifying the parameters a, b and c of the weight function of the Hampel estimator. param(1)=a param(2)=b param(3)=c If these values are not supplied they will be automatically set to a=2, b=4 c=8

Item.Name: shapeeff
Item.LongDesc: If 1, the efficiency is referred to the shape else (default) is referred to the location. TODO:Hac:shapeeff

Item.Name: bdp
Item.LongDesc: Breakdown point associated to the supplied value of c for Hampel rho function

Item.Name: eff
Item.LongDesc: Efficiency associated to the supplied value of c for Hampel rho function

HelpXML.MoreAbout:
Function HApsi transforms vector u as follows. \[ HApsi(u) = \left\{ \begin{array}{cc} u & |u| <= a \\ a \times sign(u) & a <= |u| < b \\ a \frac{c-|u|}{c-b} \times sign(u) & b <= |u| < c \\ 0 & |u| >= c \end{array} \right. \]
where $a$= ctun *param(1). $b$= ctun *param(2). $c$= ctun *param(3).
The default is $a$= 2*ctun. $b$= 4*ctun. $c$= 8*ctun.
It is necessary to have 0 <= a <= b <= c

References.Item: D. C. Hoaglin, F. Mosteller, J. W. Tukey (1982), Understanding Robust and Exploratory Data Analysis Wiley, New York.

Item.Title: bdp and eff as function of c.
Item.Desc: Analysis of breakdown point and asymptotic efficiency at the normal distribution as a function of c in regression.
